title: Texas Co-op Sells Bonds to Cover Storm Costs, Sidestepping Bankruptcy
sub_head: Rayburn Country Electric Cooperative has raised $908 million in 2049 bonds to cover costs incurred in the extreme winter weather that lashed Texas a year ago
body:
Texas electric provider Rayburn Country Electric Cooperative Inc. has sold bonds in order to pay off in full an enormous power bill from last year’s extreme winter storm, averting the possibility of bankruptcy.
The nonprofit power-plant owner opted to raise $908 million in bonds instead of filing for bankruptcy and pursuing litigation against the Electric Reliability Council of Texas, the state’s grid operator, David Naylor, the cooperative’s chief executive, said in an interview.
